alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 9:13PM EDT until March 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. .An additional one half to three quarters of an inch of rain is expected tonight through Saturday. This is expected to lead to minor flooding. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tonight to a crest of 6.3 feet after midnight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 06/14/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
